Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> Please let us know if your block height does not match the explorer. It seems that vrsc.52hash.com pool is currently on a fork. We do not have other reports of a fork from the community.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <bishop> Checked all my nodes and I'm g2g. Curious of what happened, especially with the nortarizations

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> it looks like they dropped then added a lot of hash power and had some very poor connectivity at that moment, maybe even a network split. They began mining very fast on their own fork with more than 51% of the rest of the hash it looks like while the network was split. We attempted to connect to them with a couple nodes, but we never did confirm a connection until it was all over and their fork re-merged. It seems that broader network connectivity came back before it was considered irrecoverable and proof of power used the stake on the main chain, even though he had greater hash power to reorganize him to the right chain. It wouldn't have needed the notaries, but if somehow PoP would have failed, that would have been a secondary backup as well. If it had been irrecoverable, they would have had to reset their chain, but it would not have affected the rest of the chain.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <miketout> So, basically it seems all worked as expected except the pool's network connectivity, and we will talk to him to see how to improve that. Also, it would be good for big miners to spread their hash around.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> theres a handy list of verus mining pools at https://miningpoolstats.stream/veruscoin for everybodies reference.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> having all the major mining pools directly crossconnected would mitigate such things, but if the major hashrate loses connectivity...

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> "crossconnected"?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> each pool doing addnode <poolip> for all the other pools

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <zpajk> Oh, got it!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> @jl777c i spoke about that more than once with the other pool operators, believe me on that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> they refused?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> not refused

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> just didn't listen

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jl777c> well if just one operator does it, it ends up having the same effect

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <0x03> also, given the special circumstances of the problem we faced it may be wise to have a node or two __within__ GFW territory
